meanings.definition: To surpass in brightness or brilliance.
meanings.sent1: The sun outgleamed the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile outgleamed all the other smiles in the room.
meanings.sent3: The little firefly outgleamed the street lamp, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The diamond outgleamed all the other gems in the jewelry store.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse outgleamed the full moon, guiding ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: To shine brighter than something else.
meanings.sent1: The new LED light bulb outgleamed the old incandescent one.
meanings.sent2: The polished silver spoon outgleamed the tarnished ones.
meanings.sent3: The child's excitement outgleamed the fireworks on New Year's Eve.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's determination outgleamed all the other competitors.
meanings.sent5: The fresh snow outgleamed the frost-covered ground, sparkling in the sunlight.
